com.fasterxml.clustermate.api

Class KeySpace

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.fasterxml.clustermate.api.KeySpace

  • public final class KeySpace
extends Object
    Entity that represents subset of key hashes used for finding nodes that are responsible for handling piece of content with given key hash. Space is defined with a single integer value, length, covering indexes [0, length-1[.

    Logically key space is circular, meaning that all KeyRanges are consecutive by using wrapping at the end of key hash range.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected KeyRange _emptyRange 
      protected int _length
      Length of key space; used for modulo calculations.
      static int DEFAULT_LENGTH
      We shall use a nicely divisible default length of 360; also conceptually nice analogy to degrees (since we use circular space definition).

    • Method Detail

      • range

        public KeyRange range(int from,
             int length)
        Factory method used for constructing KeyRange instances to use for key hashes in this KeySpace.
        Parameters:
        from - Starting point of the range (inclusive)
        length - Length of range; between 0 and getLength() (inclusive)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if arguments are outside range of this KeySpace

      • calcSegment

        public KeyRange calcSegment(int index,
                   int segmentCount,
                   int copies)
        Helper method called to calculate a key range of this space as defined by slicing properties. Key space will be divided in segmentCount segments, and each node will cover C segments, where C is number of copies desired. The first segment to cover is from index. The only slight complication is that of handling of key ranges not divisible evenly by number of nodes.
        Parameters:
        index - Zero-based index of the node
        segmentCount - Number of segments created in the keyspace
        copies - Number of copies of data that must exist; determines span (and overlap) of each segment
        Returns:
        Range to allocate

      • getLength

        public int getLength()

      • getCoverage

        public int getCoverage(Iterable<KeyRange> ranges)
        Method that can be used to calculate coverage of given ranges over this key space: will be [0, getLength()] between "no coverage" and "full coverage"
        Returns:
        Number of 'slots' covered by given ranges
